x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Prescription fraud is a major global issue that results in overmedication, addiction, black market sales, and insurance fraud. In many regions, paper-based prescriptions or disconnected digital systems make it easy to forge, duplicate, or alter prescriptions. This problem affects both patients' safety and healthcare system integrity, especially in underserved areas where regulation is less enforceable.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

RxChain is a secure digital prescription verification platform built on ServiceNow and integrated with a permissioned blockchain network.

The solution works as follows:

  1. Doctors issue digital prescriptions within ServiceNow, which are hashed and stored on the blockchain.

  2. Pharmacies scan the prescription ID via Service Portal and verify it against the blockchain ledger.

  3. Patients receive a secure, tamper-proof version of the prescription (via QR code or digital wallet).

  4. Regulators can monitor prescription issuance and flag unusual patterns (e.g. overprescription of opioids).

  5. All transactions are logged immutably, preventing fraud or unauthorized access.

This system ensures that only authentic prescriptions are dispensed and cannot be reused, forged, or tampered with.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  • ServiceNow App Engine – To build the digital prescription interface.
  • IntegrationHub – To connect with the blockchain layer (e.g., Hyperledger Fabric, Ethereum, or a private blockchain).
  • Flow Designer – For automation like prescription issuance, verification, and flagging patterns.
  • Service Portal – For access by pharmacies, clinics, and patients.
  • Performance Analytics – For tracking trends and suspicious prescribing activity.
  • Security Operations – For access control, compliance, and audit trails.
  • Blockchain infrastructure (either hosted or through a decentralized network like Hyperledger).
  • API integration between ServiceNow and the blockchain node (read/write functions).
  • Identity management for authenticating doctors and pharmacies.
  • Secure QR code or token system for patients to carry prescriptions.
  • Potential integration with national electronic health records or medical license registries.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  • Blockchain scalability and cost depending on the network used.
  • Resistance to change from healthcare providers unfamiliar with blockchain or digital records.
  • Onboarding pharmacies and clinics onto a shared system.
  • Ensuring data privacy and compliance (especially under HIPAA or GDPR).
  • Interoperability with existing EHR and pharmacy systems.
